meanings.definition: Used so much that it is no longer effective or interesting.
meanings.sent1: The overused joke made everyone groan.
meanings.sent2: The book had an overused plot that bored the readers.
meanings.sent3: The overused excuse of 'the dog ate my homework' didn't work this time.
meanings.sent4: Her overused catchphrase fell flat in the new TV show.
meanings.sent5: The overused song played on the radio every hour.

meanings.definition: To use something so much that it becomes less effective or interesting.
meanings.sent1: She overused her favorite perfume and now no one can stand it.
meanings.sent2: He overused his phone so much that the battery died quickly.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally overused salt in the soup, making it inedible.
meanings.sent4: The comedian overused the same joke in every performance, losing his audience.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned the students not to overuse the highlighter on their notes.
